snippet: Tom Wheeler, the commission’s chairman, said the panel would not seek greater regulation but would encourage provider choice where it did not exist.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission Chairman Tom Wheeler says agency will work to promote greater competition among providers of high-speed Internet service, but that it will stop short of seeking greater regulation; notes overwhelming majority of Americans lack real choice in providers.
lead_paragraph: Tom Wheeler, the commission’s chairman, said the panel would not seek greater regulation but would encourage provider choice where it did not exist.

headline.main: F.C.C. to Promote Choices for High-Speed Broadband
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. to Promote Choices for High-Speed Broadband
